alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:28AM PST until January 10 at 12:20PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno and Merced. * WHEN...Until 430 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 AM PST, Emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. In addition, large trees have been falling into roadways near Los Gatos Creek, including on Los Gatos Creek Rd. northwest of Coalinga. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Also, expect continued rises of streams in areas with flooding likely throughout western Fresno County, including along and just east of Interstate 5. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coalinga, Cantua Creek, Huron, Spanish Lake, Zapato Chino Creek and Castle Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
